INSTRUCTIONS

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 436, 292, 450]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 467, 808, 482]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 484, 565, 497]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 499, 478, 512]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 515, 357, 528]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 530, 483, 544]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 546, 216, 573]]<|/det|>
- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 575, 855, 606]]<|/det|>
- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[450, 133, 559, 148]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>question_part<|/ref|><|det|>[[200, 200, 200, 200]]<|/det|>
1

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[452, 200, 551, 200]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 168, 242, 183]]<|/det|>
Quadratic Equation

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 195, 388, 215]]<|/det|>
For the equation \(a x^{2}+b x+c=0\),

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[417, 214, 584, 251]]<|/det|>
\[
x=-\frac{-b \pm \sqrt{b^{2}-4 a c}}{2 a}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 275, 230, 290]]<|/det|>
Binomial Theorem

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[246, 294, 753, 333]]<|/det|>
\[
(a+b)^{n}=a^{n}+\left(\begin{array}{l}
n \\
1
\end{array}\right) a^{n-1} b+\left(\begin{array}{l}
n \\
2
\end{array}\right) a^{n-2} b^{2}+\ldots+\left(\begin{array}{l}
n \\
r
\end{array}\right) a^{n-r} b^{r}+\ldots+b^{n}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 347, 496, 384]]<|/det|>
where \(n\) is a positive integer and \(\left(\begin{array}{l}n \\ r\end{array}\right)=\frac{n !}{(n-r) ! r !}\)

<|ref|>question_part<|/ref|><|det|>[[200, 200, 200, 200]]<|/det|>
2

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 413, 388, 430]]<|/det|>
Arithmetic series \(u_{n}=a+(n-1) d\)

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[247, 434, 537, 466]]<|/det|>
\[
S_{n}=\frac{1}{2} n\left(a+l\right)=\frac{1}{2} n\left\{2 a+(n-1) d\right\}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 490, 338, 506]]<|/det|>
Geometric series \(u_{n}=a r^{n-1}\)

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[247, 509, 432, 584]]<|/det|>
\[
\begin{array}{ll}
S_{n}=\frac{a(1-r)}{1-r} & (r \neq 1) \\
S_{\infty}=\frac{a}{1-r} & (|r|<1)
\end{array}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[402, 613, 548, 629]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 645, 158, 659]]<|/det|>
Identities

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[415, 669, 587, 721]]<|/det|>
\[
\begin{array}{l}
\sin ^{2} A+\cos ^{2} A=1 \\
\sec ^{2} A=1+\tan ^{2} A \\
\sec ^{2} A=1+\cot ^{2} A
\end{array}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 767, 245, 783]]<|/det|>
Formulae for \(\Delta A B C\)

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[401, 792, 598, 888]]<|/det|>
\[
\begin{aligned}
\frac{a}{\sin A} & =\frac{b}{\sin B}=\frac{c}{\sin C} \\
a^{2} & =b^{2}+c^{2}-2 b c \cos A \\
\Delta & =\frac{1}{2} b c \sin A
\end{aligned}
\]

<|ref|>question_part<|/ref|><|det|>[[0, 0, 0, 0]]<|/det|>
1

<|ref|>question_part<|/ref|><|det|>[[200, 200, 200, 200]]<|/det|>
(a)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 75, 788, 95]]<|/det|>
1 (a) Solve the equation \(5^{w-1}=12\), giving your answer correct to 2 decimal places.

<|ref|>question_part<|/ref|><|det|>[[200, 200, 200, 200]]<|/det|>
(b)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 196, 451, 222]]<|/det|>
(b) Solve the equation \(x^{\frac{2}{3}}-5 x^{\frac{1}{3}}+6=0\).

<|ref|>question_part<|/ref|><|det|>[[200, 200, 200, 200]]<|/det|>
2

<|ref|>question_part<|/ref|><|det|>[[400, 400, 400, 400]]<|/det|>
(a)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 444, 667, 466]]<|/det|>
2 (a) Write \(2 \lg x-\left(\lg (x+6)+\lg 3\right)\) as a single logarithm to base 10 .

<|ref|>question_part<|/ref|><|det|>[[400, 400, 400, 400]]<|/det|>
(b)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 645, 592, 667]]<|/det|>
(b) Hence solve the equation \(2 \lg x-\left(\lg (x+6)+\lg 3\right)=0\).

<|ref|>question_part<|/ref|><|det|>[[0, 0, 0, 0]]<|/det|>
3

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 76, 543, 112]]<|/det|>
3 Variables \(x\) and \(y\) are such that when \(\sqrt[3]{y}\) is plotted against \(x^{2}\), a straight line passing through the points \((9,8)\) and \((16,1)\) is obtained. Find \(y\) as a function of \(x\).

<|ref|>question_part<|/ref|><|det|>[[0, 0, 0, 0]]<|/det|>
4

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 339, 648, 372]]<|/det|>
4 The polynomial \(\mathrm{p}(x)=m x^{3}-17 x^{2}+n x+6\) has a factor \(x-3\). It has a remainder of \(-12\) when divided by \(x+1\). Find the remainder when \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is divided by \(x-2\).

<|ref|>question_part<|/ref|><|det|>[[0, 0, 0, 0]]<|/det|>
5

<|ref|>question_part<|/ref|><|det|>[[200, 200, 200, 200]]<|/det|>
(a)

<|ref|>question_part<|/ref|><|det|>[[400, 400, 400, 400]]<|/det|>
(i)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 76, 891, 92]]<|/det|>
5 (a) (i) Write down, in ascending powers of \(x\), the first three terms in the expansion of \((1+4 x)^{n}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[196, 92, 350, 107]]<|/det|>
Simplify each term.

<|ref|>question_part<|/ref|><|det|>[[400, 400, 400, 400]]<|/det|>
(ii)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[152, 275, 311, 307]]<|/det|>
(ii) In the expansion of \((1+4 x)^{n}(1-4 x)\) the coefficient of \(x^{2}\) is 6032 . Given that \(n>0\), find the value of \(n\).

<|ref|>question_part<|/ref|><|det|>[[200, 200, 200, 200]]<|/det|>
(b)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 622, 653, 659]]<|/det|>
(b) Find the term independent of \(x\) in the expansion of \(\left(\frac{x}{2}-\frac{8}{x^{4}}\right)^{10}\).

<|ref|>question_part<|/ref|><|det|>[[0, 0, 0, 0]]<|/det|>
6

<|ref|>question_part<|/ref|><|det|>[[200, 200, 200, 200]]<|/det|>
(a)

<|ref|>question_part<|/ref|><|det|>[[400, 400, 400, 400]]<|/det|>
(i)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 74, 446, 122]]<|/det|>
6 (a) (i) A 5-digit number is to be formed from the seven digits 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6 . Each digit can be used at most once in any number and the number does not start with 0 . Find the number of ways in which this can be done.

<|ref|>question_part<|/ref|><|det|>[[400, 400, 400, 400]]<|/det|>
(ii)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[152, 290, 588, 307]]<|/det|>
(ii) Find how many of these 5-digit numbers are even.

<|ref|>question_part<|/ref|><|det|>[[200, 200, 200, 200]]<|/det|>
(b)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 599, 678, 630]]<|/det|>
(b) A team of 7 people is to be selected from a group of 9 women and 6 men. Find the number of different teams that can be selected which include at least one man.

<|ref|>question_part<|/ref|><|det|>[[200, 200, 200, 200]]<|/det|>
(c)

<|ref|>question_part<|/ref|><|det|>[[400, 400, 400, 400]]<|/det|>
(i)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 76, 562, 102]]<|/det|>
(c) (i) Show that \({{ }^{n} C}_{3}+{{ }^{n} C}_{2}=\frac{1}{6}\left(n^{3}-n\right)\) for \(n \geqslant 3\).

<|ref|>question_part<|/ref|><|det|>[[400, 400, 400, 400]]<|/det|>
(ii)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[152, 513, 648, 533]]<|/det|>
(ii) Hence solve the equation \({{ }^{n} C}_{3}+{{ }^{n} C}_{2}=4 n\) where \(n \geqslant 3\).

<|ref|>question_part<|/ref|><|det|>[[0, 0, 0, 0]]<|/det|>
7

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 74, 576, 132]]<|/det|>
7 Variables \(x\) and \(y\) are such that \(y=\frac{\left(1+\sin 3 x\right)^{4}}{\sqrt{x}}\). Use differentiation to find the approximate change in \(y\) when \(x\) increases from 1.9 to \(1.9+h\), where \(h\) is small.

<|ref|>question_part<|/ref|><|det|>[[0, 0, 0, 0]]<|/det|>
8

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 74, 446, 107]]<|/det|>
8 In this question, \(\mathbf{i}\) is a unit vector due east and \(\mathbf{j}\) is a unit vector due north. Distances are measured in kilometres and time is measured in hours.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 119, 466, 155]]<|/det|>
At 0900, ship \(A\) leaves a point \(P\) with position vector \(5 \mathbf{i}+16 \mathbf{j}\) relative to an origin \(O\). It sails with a constant speed of \(6 \sqrt{3}\) on a bearing of \(120^{\circ}\).

<|ref|>question_part<|/ref|><|det|>[[200, 200, 200, 200]]<|/det|>
(a)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 168, 543, 186]]<|/det|>
(a) Show that the velocity vector of \(A\) is \(9 \mathbf{i}-3 \sqrt{3} \mathbf{j}\).

<|ref|>question_part<|/ref|><|det|>[[200, 200, 200, 200]]<|/det|>
(b)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 400, 451, 417]]<|/det|>
(b) Find the position vector of \(A\) at 1200 .

<|ref|>question_part<|/ref|><|det|>[[200, 200, 200, 200]]<|/det|>
(c)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 540, 741, 575]]<|/det|>
(c) At 1100 ship \(B\) leaves a point \(Q\) with position vector \(29 \mathbf{i}+16 \mathbf{j}\). It sails with constant velocity \(-12 \sqrt{3} \mathbf{j}\). Write down the position vector of \(B, t\) hours after it starts sailing.

<|ref|>question_part<|/ref|><|det|>[[200, 200, 200, 200]]<|/det|>
(d)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 679, 537, 697]]<|/det|>
(d) Find the distance between the two ships at 1200 .

<|ref|>question_part<|/ref|><|det|>[[0, 0, 0, 0]]<|/det|>
9

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 74, 438, 92]]<|/det|>
9 In this question all lengths are in metres.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[334, 97, 666, 243]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 259, 521, 307]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows a water container in the shape of a triangular prism. The depth of water in the container is \(h\). The container has length 5 . The water in the container forms a prism with a uniform cross-section that is an equilateral triangle of side \(x\).

<|ref|>question_part<|/ref|><|det|>[[200, 200, 200, 200]]<|/det|>
(a)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 308, 656, 344]]<|/det|>
(a) Show that the volume, \(V\), of the water is given by \(V=\frac{5 \sqrt{3} h^{2}}{3}\).

<|ref|>question_part<|/ref|><|det|>[[200, 200, 200, 200]]<|/det|>
(b)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 595, 645, 630]]<|/det|>
(b) Water is pumped into the container at a rate of \(0.5 \mathrm{~m}^{3}\) per minute. Find the rate at which the depth of the water is increasing when the depth of the water is 0.1 m .

<|ref|>question_part<|/ref|><|det|>[[0, 0, 0, 0]]<|/det|>
10

<|ref|>question_part<|/ref|><|det|>[[200, 200, 200, 200]]<|/det|>
(a)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 74, 673, 93]]<|/det|>
10 (a) Differentiate \(x \ln x-2 x\) with respect to \(x\). Simplify your answer.

<|ref|>question_part<|/ref|><|det|>[[200, 200, 200, 200]]<|/det|>
(b)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 216, 918, 261]]<|/det|>
(b) A curve is such that \(\frac{\mathrm{d}^{2} y}{\mathrm{~d} x^{2}}=\left(\frac{x+1}{\sqrt{x}}\right)^{2}\). It is given that \(\frac{\mathrm{d} y}{\mathrm{~d} x}=\frac{\mathrm{e}^{2}}{2}+2 \mathrm{e}\) at the point \(\left(\mathrm{e}, \frac{\mathrm{e}^{3}}{6}+\mathrm{e}^{2}\right)\). Using your answer to part (a), find the exact equation of the curve.

<|ref|>question_part<|/ref|><|det|>[[0, 0, 0, 0]]<|/det|>
11

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 74, 105, 91]]<|/det|>
11

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[267, 92, 733, 344]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 355, 672, 432]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows part of the curves \(y=\mathrm{e}^{\frac{x}{2}}\) and \(y=\cos 5 x\) and part of the line \(x=\frac{\pi}{4}\). The curves intersect at \(A\). The curve \(y=\cos 5 x\) cuts the \(x\)-axis at \(B\). The line \(x=\frac{\pi}{4}\) cuts the \(x\)-axis at \(C\) and the curve \(y=\mathrm{e}^{\frac{x}{2}}\) at \(D\). Find the exact area of the shaded region, \(A B C D\).
